Key Match Events: Shayan Jahangir was out to the first ball of the game, trapped LBW by Arshdeep Singh
Andries Gous skied a pull shot straight up in the air
Saurabh Netravalkar dismissed Kohli for a golden duck in the first over
Rohit Sharma was pouched by Harmeet Singh after a leading edge
Ali Khan snuck through Rishabh Pant's defence to leave India reeling at 39 for three
Netravalkar dropped Suryakumar Yadav after he heaved a Van Schalkwyk delivery straight up in the air
The U.S. was penalised five runs for failing three times in an innings to start the new over within a minute
Yadav and Shivam Dube saw the game out for India with a partnership worth 67 runs off 66 balls
Post-Match Reflections: The U.S. battled well to set a target of 110 but saw that total chased down with 10 balls to spare
Netravalkar came back into the attack to bowl two more tight overs but, by that stage, India had taken full control
Miscellaneous Highlights: The U.S. winning streak at the T20 Cricket World Cup has been ended
India won the toss and chose to bowl first
India won the match by 7 wickets
The U.S. will make the 1,300-mile trip down the east coast to face Ireland at Central Broward Park & Broward County Stadium in Lauderhill on Friday
The Super Eight stage is scheduled to start on Thursday, June 20
Others: Ed Mackey is an Explainer Journalist for The Athletic, based in Leicester
